total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a 10x10 grid, which is twice the size of the input grid.
Q3: Observe that the first half of the output grid is a mirror image of the input grid with the center value replaced by the outermost value of the input grid.
Q4: Notice that the second half of the output grid is a mirror image of the first half, but with the center value replaced by the outermost value of the first half.
Q5: Apply these observations to the quiz input grid to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a 10x10 grid, which is a mirrored version of the 5x5 input grid along the vertical axis.
Q3: Identify the transformation rules for each cell in the input grid to the corresponding cells in the output grid.
Q4: Apply the transformation rules to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
